overview_of_class: In the second quarter of Elementary Persian, students will begin to narrate in the past, present, and future, and describe people and places in more complex ways. Specifically, students will be able to discuss what they did last week and over the summer, and to converse with others about their social, professional, and academic plans for the future. They will also be able to compare objects and locales that they are familiar with, such cities and countries that they have visited, and to describe their friends and family in more detail.

descriptions.name: Registration Requirements
descriptions.value: PERS 111-1 or permission of the instructor

descriptions.name: Teaching Method
descriptions.value: Class time is devoted to language production in small groups; grammar is taught inductively; vocabulary is studied at home.

descriptions.name: Evaluation Method
descriptions.value: Weekly quizzes combined five project-based assessments

descriptions.name: Class Materials (Required)
descriptions.value: Shahsavari and Atwood, Persian of Iran Today, Vol. 2; Saeed Yousef and Hayedeh Torabi, Basic Persian (recommended)
